stadium.name: The Oakmaul Grounds
stadium.description: Built over the site of the final battle during the liberation of Hafting now rises The Oakmaul Grounds‚Äîpart arena, part monument. The central oak still bears the burn scars of the final battle. Troll ball here feels more like ritual than sport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Wiggling their fingers in a complex, magical-looking pattern.
Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Asking the Trollball for advice, and pretending to listen to its response.
Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Anointing their forehead with morning dew.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Asking the Trollball for advice, and pretending to listen to its response.
Anointing their forehead with morning dew.
Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.

stadium.name: The Stronghold Bailey
stadium.description: The team plays in the central bailey of Stronghold Castle, a massive fortress built on a plateau overlooking the city. The field is packed earth and cobblestone, and the crowd watches from the surrounding stone ramparts.

stats.pregame_ritual: Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Searching for a four-leaf clover near the sidelines.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Sharing a piece of fermented fish with a teammate.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Eating a piece of honeycomb to 'sweeten' their victory.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Seeing who on the team can belch the loudest.
Tying a red string around their pinky finger.
Sharing a piece of fermented fish with a teammate.
Searching for a four-leaf clover near the sidelines.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Sharing a piece of fermented fish with a teammate.

Tugging on their left earlobe three times.

preGame:
Hello, hello, hello, sports fans! This is Nok the Corrupter coming to you live from the hallowed, blood-stained turf of The Oakmaul Grounds in Hafting! üéôÔ∏è It is a beautiful evening under the 'Scarred Oak's Shadow,' and the air is thick with the sweet scent of desperation! We are deep in the Losers Bracket of the playoffs, and folks, this is a do-or-die situation for The New Ravenfall Commanders! After dropping Game One in a heart-wrenching overtime thriller, the Commanders are backed into a corner, and you know what they say‚Äîa cornered beast is the most fun to watch when it starts swinging! üèüÔ∏è

The atmosphere here is positively ritualistic! The Greenwatch fans are out in force, though their popularity seems a bit tepid compared to the traveling New Ravenfall faithful who have packed the stands, likely hoping for a glimpse of Sir Tanos or some other high-and-mighty Eponore elite to save the day! üå≥ I saw Salahi Bushey anointing his forehead with morning dew earlier‚Äîtruly a quaint little superstition‚Äîwhile Rese Halpern was taking deep whiffs of her game-worn socks. Talk about a sensory experience that would make a demon weep with joy! It‚Äôs all part of the 'Ritual Focus' here in Hafting, and believe me, the spirits are restless!

But don't count out those Commanders! They‚Äôve got a chip on their shoulder as big as the Stronghold Bailey! Jozef Pepe has been leading a pre-game belching contest that has the local birds fleeing for the hills, and Estes Adrian is currently elbow-deep in a jar of honeycomb, looking to 'sweeten' the upcoming slaughter! üçØ These Commanders might be on the brink of elimination, but they look ready to turn this 'Hallowed Ground' into a graveyard! Will the Warden's favorites, like that fancy-bow-toting Sir Randy, be cheering from the sidelines? Who cares! We‚Äôre here for the crunch of bone and the roar of the crowd! Let‚Äôs get this Game Two started! ü¶¥üí•
postGame:
Holy moly, what a display of absolute carnage! üì£ If you like your Trollball with a side of shattered teeth and a main course of total dominance, then I hope you were tuned in to the wireless for this one! The New Ravenfall Commanders have roared back to life, absolutely dismantling The Greenwatch with a 5-1 victory that has sent this Best of Three series to a winner-take-all Game Three! It was a performance so dominant it would make God King Sir Artorias look like a rank amateur! üèÜ

Things got spicy right out of the gate when Jozef Pepe scooped up the troll head in Center Field. But the Greenwatch wasn't just going to stand there; Nobe Haukom immediately reminded everyone why this is a contact sport by sending Pirozzo Opal to the healer's tent with a tackle that sounded like a dry branch snapping! ü™µ The crowd was still cheering the hit when Croteau Osmo decided to silence them, stepping back and firing a majestic long-distance shot that zipped right through the goal for a two-point 'Shoot!' Talk about an opening statement!

As the first half raged on, the Commanders' Moir Sass decided to play surgeon, absolutely leveling Darin Berliner and sending her off for repairs. Not to be outdone, Troy Jorgan struck back for the home team by cracking Croteau Osmo's ribs, but the momentum was firmly in the Commanders' favor! Dusa Curson joined the fray, putting Salahi Bushey on his back with a tackle that had the 'Castle Echo' ringing all the way back to New Ravenfall! By the time the halftime whistle blew, the field looked more like a battlefield than a ball pitch! üè•

When we returned for the second half, the Commanders didn't let up for a single second. Pirozzo Opal, fresh from the healer's magic fingers, showed incredible grit by lining up another long-distance blast! üéØ Boom! Another two points for the Commanders! The Greenwatch players were looking like they‚Äôd spent too much time at Imra‚Äôs bar and not enough time in the gym. Drona Jacklin tried to slow things down by injuring Pirozzo Opal (again!), but it was too little, too late.

Then came the play of the game! Estes Adrian, fueled by that pre-game honeycomb, snagged the ball and went on a tear! üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è He dodged Kirkhammers and Mallets like he was dancing at a fey circus, finally leaping into the End Zone for a thunderous dunk! That five-point lead felt like a mountain for the Greenwatch, and even with the 'Ritual Focus' of the grounds, they were looking more like sacrificial lambs than warriors.

I have to give a tiny bit of credit to Salahi Bushey, who managed to salvage a bit of pride for the Greenwatch. He found a seam in the defense and dunked the ball home to put one point on the board for the home crowd. But the celebration was short-lived! The Commanders were in a predatory mood. Rhett Gavrilla absolutely demolished Darin Berliner (who really should consider a career in something safer, like lace-making), and Moir Sass capped off the brutality by knocking Herriott Dhiren into next week! üí•

By the end of the match, the Greenwatch was a mess of bruises and broken dreams. Even with Goldenberg Rimola trying to communicate with the birds for advice, the only thing the birds were saying was 'get out of the way!' üê¶ The series is now tied 1-1, and the tension in the air is thicker than one of Chairman Toland‚Äôs loaves of bread! This is what playoff Trollball is all about‚Äîdesperation, violence, and the beautiful sight of 'Heroes' getting knocked into the dirt!

I must say, the Commanders' fans are making so much noise you‚Äôd think Governor-King Zenku himself was on the field! It‚Äôs a complete turnaround from Game One. The Greenwatch looked sluggish, perhaps a bit too much 'morning dew' and not enough 'fighting spirit.' They were stumbling around like they‚Äôd been hit by one of Cyfnerth‚Äôs meat cleavers before the game even started! üòµ‚Äçüí´

The Commanders' healer, Hooge Imtiaz, barely had to break a sweat compared to Nariko Javed, who I assume is currently out of bandages and magic. Dusa Curson and Moir Sass were the MVPs of the night, turning the pitch into a masterclass of defensive violence. It was a sight to behold, folks! Pure, unadulterated joy in every crunch! ü¶∑

So here we go! Game Three is on the horizon! The loser will be cast down into the pits of the bracket while the winner lives to fight another day in this glorious Everwar of ours! Will the Commanders complete the comeback, or will the Greenwatch find their footing in the dirt once more? üèîÔ∏è

As we wrap things up here at the Oakmaul Grounds, I‚Äôm heading over to find Yarp and see if he‚Äôll finally let me place a wager on my beloved Ebon Gate Corruptors for their next outing! If you see Sir Tanos, tell him I‚Äôve got a very sharp letter-opener with his name on it! ‚öîÔ∏è This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off for Tuesday Night Trollball! Stay brutal, Osterra! Goodnight! üéôÔ∏èüíÄ
